intro: Codonachne neesiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf codonopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including India and China, and thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant features slender, erect stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its small, white or greenish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Codonachne neesiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
